decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [A1238-00-00, 01 � 01, 01 � 02, 01 � 03, 01 � 04, 01 � 05, Fire Safety, Design & Access Statement received 05/07/2024
A1238 � 02 -10 Rev A, A1238 � 02 -01 Rev A,  A1238 � 02 -02, A1238 � 02 -03, A1238 � 02 -04, A1238 � 02 -05, A1238 � 02 -06, A1238 � 02 -06  Rev B, A1238 � 02 -07, A1238 � 02 -08, A1238 � 02 -09, A1238 � 02 -10 Rev A received 18/09/2024
Energy statement received 04/09/2024
Plant noise report received 09/10/2024].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public. 
Reason: In order to protect the living conditions of neighbouring residents.

Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until a Construction Method Statement (CMS) relating to the basement hereby approved has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority. The CMS shall be certified by a qualified professional and give details of excavation, temporary works and construction techniques, including details of potential impacts on neighbouring land based on assessment of the geology and hydrology of the area. The approved CMS shall be adhered to throughout the construction period for the development.
Reason: In order to protect the living conditions of neighbouring residents, to minimise flood risk and to ensure highway safety is maintained.

Condition : 7 - The development shall not commence until details of a Construction Management Plan has been submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Plan must include:
�	Details of the erection and maintenance of security hoarding.
�	Details of hours of construction, including deliveries.
�	Details of the method of piling. 
�	The provision of sound insulation required mitigating or eliminating specific environmental impacts including noise, dust, vibration and smoke.
�	Arrangements for publicity and promotion of the scheme during construction. 
�	A commitment to Considerate Contractor Scheme registration. 
�	Details of construction traffic minimisation measures on the local highway network, including the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors, loading and unloading of plant and materials and storage of plant and materials used in constructing the development.
�	Measures to ensure that all mud and other loose materials are not carried on the wheels and chassis of any vehicles leaving the site.
�	Details of any external illumination of the site.
�	Details of a Waste Minimisation Statement, confirming how demolition and construction waste will be recovered and reused on site or at other sites in accordance with Circular Economy principles.
All demolition and construction work shall be undertaken in strict accordance with the approved management plan, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason To ensure that neighbours and occupiers of neighbouring premises do not suffer a loss of amenity by reason of pollution and nuisance.

Condition : 8 - The basement hereby permitted shall at no time be used or occupied as a separate dwelling independent of the main house and shall not be used as sleeping accommodation.
Reason: In order to ensure that adequate living standards are maintained and to protect neighbours' living conditions.

Condition : 9 - The windows formed in the east elevation shall be obscure-glazed and non-opening below 1.7 metres above internal floor level. The windows shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than in accordance with the requirements of this condition. 
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' privacy

Condition : 10 - The external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA in order to prevent any adverse impact. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014+A1:2019 at the nearest and/or most affected noise sensitive premises, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.
Due to the required mitigation strategy, a post installation noise assessment shall be carried out to confirm compliance with the sound criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.
Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from plant/mechanical installations/equipment.
description: Demolition of the existing side garage and house to facilitate the erection of a two storey house with a two storey side extension and part single part double storey rear extension, erection of a basement extension with front and rear lightwells, erection of a rear roof extension with two front and two rear roof windows, replacement of roof tiles and replacement of all UPVC windows with timber windows. Installation of a condenser within an enclosure at the rear of the garden and electric vehicle sliding gates at the front
